vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/a79b74cd-ce2a-435a-9250-ad5453874690">ZIMBABWE</keyword>         <topcClas>Economic conditions and indicators - Economics</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>International Monetary Fund (IMF) Balance of Payments (BOPS)</i> database is a statistical statement containing over 100,000 quarterly and annual time series data that summarise, for a specific period (typically a year or quarter), the economic transactions of an economy with the rest of the world. It covers:<ul><li>all the goods, services, factor income and current transfers an economy receives from or provides to the rest of the world</li><li>capital transfers and changes in an economy's external financial claims and liabilities</li></ul>This database was first provided by the UK Data Service in June 2004. The UK Data Service web site includes further information on its <i>IMF BOPS</i> holdings, including a <a href="http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/bops.aspx" title ="IMF Balance of Payments dataset user guide">dataset user guide</a> and details of <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/imf/bops/2011-09" title ="IMF Balance of Payments latest database updates">latest database updates</a>.<br> <br> <b>Citation:</b> The bibliographic citation for the database is: International Monetary Fund (<i>{YYYY}</i>): Balance of Payment Statistics (<i>{date/edition of dataset}</i>). Mimas, University of Manchester. DOI: <i>{edition specific doi - e.g. <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/imf/bops/2011-09">http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/imf/bops/2011-09</a>}</i>. <br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The database covers:<ul><li>balance of payments</li><li>economics, international and monetary economics</li><li>international monetary system</li><li>currencies</li><li>monetary economics</li><li>international economics</li><li>foreign investment</li><li>international, foreign and world trade</li><li>exchange rates and foreign exchange</li></ul></abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd>When data are available, annual entries generally begin in 1967 (with a small number from 1948) and quarterly entries begin in 1970 until the latest available. The period for which data are available varies from country to country, but most countries' data extend from the mid-1970s to the present.</timePrd>         <nation>Multi-nation</nation>         <geogUnit>Countries</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Administrative units (geographical/political)</anlyUnit>         <universe>Cross-national; National</universe>         <universe>Over 200 countries are covered in the database: Afghanistan, Albania, Algeria, Angola, Antigua and Barbuda, Argentina, Armenia, Australia, Austria, Azerbaijan, Bahamas, Bahrain, Bangladesh, Barbados, Belarus, Belgium, Belize, Benin, Bolivia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Botswana, Brazil, Bulgaria, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cambodia, Cameroon, Canada, Cape Verde, Central African Republic, Chad, Chile, China, Colombia, Comoros, Congo, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Costa Rica, Cote d'Ivoire, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Czechoslovakia,  Denmark, Djibouti, Dominica, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, Egypt, El Salvador, Equatorial Guinea, Eritrea, Estonia, Ethiopia, Faroe Islands, Fiji, Finland, France, French Polynesia, Gabon, Gambia, Gaza Strip, Georgia, Germany, Ghana, Greece, Grenada, Guatemala, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, Guyana, Haiti, Honduras, Hungary, Iceland, India, Indonesia, Islamic Republic of Iran, Iraq, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Jamaica, Japan, Jordan, Kazakstan, Kenya, Kiribati, Korea, Kuwait, Kyrgyzstan, People's Democratic Republic of Lao, Latvia, Lebanon, Lesotho, Liberia, Libyan Arab Republic, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Macedonia, Madagascar, Malawi, Malaysia, Maldives, Mali, Malta, Mauritania, Mauritius, Mexico, Republic of Moldova, Mongolia, Montserrat, Morocco, Mozambique, Myanmar, Namibia, Nepal, Netherlands, Netherlands Antilles, New Caledonia, New Zealand, Nicaragua, Niger, Nigeria, Norway, Oman, Pakistan, Panama, Papua New Guinea, Paraguay, Peru, Philippines, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Russian Federation, Rwanda, Saint Kitts and Nevis, Saint Lucia, Saint Vincent and the Grenadines, Samoa, Sao Tome and Principe, Saudi Arabia, Senegal, Serbia and Montenegro, Seychelles, Sierra Leone, Singapore, Slovakia, Slovenia, Solomon Islands, Somalia, South Africa, Spain, Sri Lanka, Sudan, Suriname, Sweden, Switzerland, Syrian Arab Republic, Tajikistan, United Republic of Tanzania, Thailand, Togo, Tonga, Trinidad and Tobago, Tunisia, Turkey, Turkmenistan, Uganda, Ukraine, United Kingdom, United States, Uruguay, Vanuatu, Venezuela, Vietnam, West Bank, Yemen Arab Republic, Yemen People's Democratic Republic, Yugoslavia, Zambia, Zimbabwe.</universe> <timeMeth>quarterly and annual. These data are updated once a month</timeMeth>         <sampProc>See documentation for details</sampProc>         <collMode>The UK Data Service provides a comprehensive <a href=http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/bops.aspx>dataset user guide</a> which includes information on documentation and methodologies used to compile the BOPS database.</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting used.  See documentation for details.</weight>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Open</specPerm>         <restrctn>Effective January 1st 2015, the IMF introduced a new policy whereby access to the IMF online statistics databases became free to all users.  As a result of this policy the IMF datasets hosted by the UK Data Service are now freely available to all. Please refer to the IMF's <a href="http://www.imf.org/external/terms.htm" title="Special Terms and Conditions Pertaining to the Use of Data">Special Terms and Conditions Pertaining to the Use of Data</a>.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relStdy>4745 IMF Direction of Trade Statistics, 1980-2014 </relStdy>       <relStdy>4772 IMF International Financial Statistics, 1948-2014 </relStdy>       <relStdy>4994 IMF Government Finance Statistics, 1990-2014 </relStdy>       <relStdy>5761 IMF World Economic Outlook, 1980-2018 </relStdy>       <relStdy>7271 IMF Annual Report on Exchange Arrangements and Exchange Restrictions, 1999-2013 </relStdy>       <relStdy>7302 IMF eLibrary Text Collection, 1951-2013 </relStdy>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
